info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 3:00AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Van Buren, northwestern Cleburne, Conway, northern Faulkner and southeastern Pope Counties through 345 AM CDT... At 300 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Clinton to Hattieville. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Conway... Heber Springs... Morrilton... Clinton... Fairfield Bay... Greenbrier... Greers Ferry... Wooster... Quitman... Guy... Damascus... Enola... Twin Groves... Menifee... Shirley... Concord... Higden... Bethlehem... Hill Creek... Hattieville... This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 98 and 119. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
